title: Job Openings at Strait Sahara Microfinance Bank Limited
content:
Strait Sahara Microfinance Bank Limited is recruiting suitable candidates to fill the following positions below:

1.) Marketer

Job Location: Makurdi, Benue
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We seek a motivated Marketer to promote our bank's financial products and services, drive business growth, and enhance our market presence.
	Responsibilities will include deposit mobilization, loan acquisition, customer relationship management, and identifying new business opportunities while nurturing existing client relationships.


Key Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Develop and implement effective marketing strategies to attract clients and grow the bank’s portfolio.
	Identify and establish relationships with potential clients across various industries within and outside the locality.
	Promote the bank’s financial products and services, including loans, savings accounts, and investment opportunities.
	Conduct market research to identify new business opportunities, support the creation of new products and stay ahead of industry trends.
	Prepare and deliver presentations and proposals to prospective clients.
	Collaborate with internal teams to ensure that the needs of clients are met.
	Monitor market activities and competitors to refine marketing strategies.
	Achieve and exceed sales targets set by the bank.


Performance Indicators


	Deposit mobilization targets
	Account Creation
	Loan disbursement and portfolio quality
	Customer retention rate
	Identify potential loan and deposit markets and develop referral networks
	Perform any other duties as may be assigned by Management.


Qualifications


	2-3 years of experience inmarketing, preferably in the banking or financial services sector
	Market Planning and Market Research skills
	Communication and Sales skills
	Proficiency in use of banking software and CRM systems.
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
	Ability to work independently
	Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, or any related field
	Strong understanding of marketing banking/financial products.


Why Join Us


	Opportunity to work with a leading financial institution focused on innovation and growth.
	Competitive salary and performance-based incentives.
	Professional development opportunities and career advancement.
	Collaborative and supportive work environment.
	An opportunity to earn target incentive for meeting 80% of sales target.


Click here to apply online

 

 

2.) IT Personnel

Job Location: Makurdi, Benue
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The IT Personnel is responsible for managing and securing the bank's digital infrastructure, ensuring smooth operations of banking systems, and supporting digital banking solutions. We are looking for a qualified Tech Support Officer to join our IT team.
	The successful candidate will be responsible for providing technical support for hardware, new technology, networking, and applications.
	This role requires vast knowledge in different operating systems, proficiency in Microsoft/Office 365, and all related applications.
	Proficiency in use of different core banking applications s will be an added advantage


Key Responsibilities


	Manage, troubleshoot, and maintain the bank's IT systems, hardware, software, network infrastructure, servers, and databases.
	Ensure cybersecurity measures are in place to protect customer and bank details.
	Support digital banking platforms, including mobile and online banking services.
	Provide IT support to employees, including technical support, troubleshooting, and resolution of hardware and software issues.
	Implement and upgrade technology solutions to improve banking operations.
	Stay updated with the latest technology trends and provide support for new technology implementations.
	Offer networking support, including configuration, troubleshooting, and maintenance of network systems.
	Support and maintain different operating systems (Windows, macOS, Linux) and Microsoft/Office 365 applications.
	Document technical issues and resolutions to build a knowledge base.
	Train staff on new technologies and software applications.
	Collaborate with the IT team to develop strategies for improving IT services and support.
	Ensure compliance with IT policies and procedures and maintain a high level of security for all IT systems.
	Communicate effectively with internal stakeholders, providing regular updates on support activities, issue resolution, and system status.


Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or related fields.
	Minimum of 3 - 4 years of experience in IT support, networking or system administration.
	Proficiency in database management, cybersecurity and networking.
	Experience with banking software and fintech solutions is an added advantage.
	Strong troubleshooting, communication and problem-solving skills.


Click here to apply online

 

 

3.) Operations Manager

Job Location: Makurdi, Benue
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Operations Manager role is responsible for driving the bank's operational efficiency, innovation, and service excellence while ensuring regulatory compliance and managing operational risk.
	The position involves overseeing daily banking operations, developing and implementing strategic initiatives, and providing expert advisory to key stakeholders.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and implement operational policies, systems, and controls to improve efficiency and mitigate risks
	Oversee daily banking operations, including payments, settlements, account services, and customer service
	Provide best practice solutions to business problems and support evolving business needs
	Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and manage operational risk
	Lead and coach operations teams to establish a performance-driven culture
	Implement continuous service and customer experience monitoring systems
	Build valued relationships with internal and external stakeholders
	Receive and disburse local currencies for approved transactions, accurately counting, verifying, and recording all cash transactions
	Handle deposits in line with CBN guidelines and internal policies
	Maintain a daily cash register, submit transaction summaries, and reconcile cash balances
	Provide excellent customer service, resolving complaints and promoting products and services
	Collaborate with other team members to achieve sales and customer service goals


Requirements


	Bachelor's degree in finance, business administration, or a related field
	2 - 3 years of experience in Fintech operations, Banking and Payment, knowledge of fintech products and services
	Certifications in operations management or related areas are a plus
	Proficiency in financial operations management, risk management, and compliance
	Experience in Business Analysis and design
	IT experience is a plus
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
	Excellent leadership and team management abilities
	Effective communication and interpersonal skills
	Attention to detail and ability to multitask


Core Areas of Focus


	Operations Oversight
	Business Advisory
	Business Support
	Regulatory Compliance
	Risk Management
	Continuous Service Improvement
	Stakeholder Management
	Team Leadership.


Click here to apply online    

    

        Click here to Apply

title: Job Openings at Pulse Nigeria
content:
Pulse is Africa's leading innovative media company, informing and engaging Africa’s young audience and producing content and creative digital marketing solutions for top brands. We run news platforms and social channels and marketing and production in four countries - Nigeria, Ghana, Kenya and Senegal.

We are the platform leading in reach - with over 100 million users and over 100 million video views on our own channels per month. We're also a marketing partner, empowering brands with our expansive media reach and 360 degree in-house marketing solutions. Additionally, Pulse is the licensee publisher of the regional Business Insider Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



1.) Features Lead

Job Location: Maryland, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	We are hiring a Features Lead to oversee, shape, and execute Pulse Nigeria’s long-form storytelling and culture coverage.
	This role blends editorial leadership with production logistics, managing the full process of ideation, writing, editing, and producing feature stories, both digital and on the ground.
	The Features Lead will combine creative vision with operational precision, ensuring that stories not only read well but are delivered efficiently across platforms.
	You will lead a small editorial and production team, coordinating with video, design, and social units to create multi-format stories that capture how young Nigerians live, work, and express themselves — across lifestyle, culture, society, and innovation


Key Responsibilities
Editorial Direction & Story Planning:


	Develop a clear editorial strategy for feature storytelling aligned with Pulse Nigeria’s content priorities.
	Build and maintain a content calendar for features, special reports, and cultural deep dives.
	Identify timely and original story ideas that reflect youth perspectives, social trends, and underreported narratives.
	Collaborate with the Editor-in-Chief to decide which stories deserve extended coverage or multimedia treatment.


Writing, Editing & Story Development:


	Guide stories from pitch to publication, ensuring they meet Pulse’s editorial standards.
	Edit features for clarity, depth, and structure while maintaining an authentic, youthful tone.
	Collaborate with the design and video teams to strengthen storytelling through visuals and multimedia elements.
	Ensure stories balance depth and readability, connecting emotionally with digital audiences.


Logistics & Production Coordination:


	Oversee the planning and coordination of feature shoots, field reporting, and on-location interviews.
	Manage logistics, including scheduling, crew coordination, transport, and permissions for production-related features.
	Work closely with the Video Production team to ensure alignment on timelines and story direction.
	Track deadlines, manage editorial workflows, and ensure smooth cross-department collaboration.
	Maintain an organised archive of past and ongoing features, assets, and documentation.


Writer & Contributor Management:


	Lead, mentor, and edit work from in-house writers and external contributors.
	Provide editorial feedback and ensure consistent story quality across the team.
	Expand Pulse Nigeria’s network of freelance writers, photographers, and field collaborators.
	Manage commissioning and payments for contributors, in coordination with finance and operations.


Audience & Platform Collaboration:


	Partner with the Head of Social Content to amplify features across Instagram, X, TikTok, and YouTube.
	Work with the Growth and SEO teams to optimise visibility and search performance for long-form stories.
	Adapt feature angles into shorter, social-friendly formats that maintain storytelling impact.
	Collaborate with video teams to develop companion pieces or feature documentaries.


Performance, Reporting & Insights:


	
	Track and analyse performance metrics for published features, including views, engagement, and dwell time.
	
	
	Use insights to refine storytelling strategy and highlight winning formats.
	
	
	Present monthly reports on feature desk output, quality, and logistics performance.
	


Innovation & Special Projects:


	Develop new feature formats, interactive packages, or multimedia storytelling ideas.
	Partner with brand and creative teams on editorially aligned sponsored features.
	Experiment with data-driven storytelling, photo essays, and short-form visual features.


Requirements


	6+ years of experience in journalism, with at least 2 years in feature editing or long-form content leadership.
	Strong editorial judgment and writing/editing experience across lifestyle, culture, and social commentary.
	Proven ability to manage both creative direction and operational logistics for editorial projects.
	Experience coordinating production shoots, field interviews, or multimedia storytelling.
	Excellent project management and multitasking skills.
	Strong collaboration and communication skills across departments.
	Familiarity with SEO, social media trends, and data-driven storytelling.
	Experience leading small teams and managing contributors.


Benefits


	Flexible Hybrid Work Model
	Health Insurance Cover
	Group Life Insurance Cover
	Contributory Pension Scheme
	Annual Bonuses
	Telecommunication Allowance.


Application Closing Date: 25th November, 2025.

Click here to apply online

 

 

2.) Head of Design

Job Location: Maryland, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	We are hiring a Head of Design to lead the creative vision and visual identity of Pulse Nigeria across all its touchpoints - editorial, social, and branded content.
	The Head of Design will define and own how Pulse Nigeria looks, feels, and communicates visually. From the design of news stories and original series to campaign visuals and platform experiences, this role will guide every creative decision that shapes the Pulse Nigeria brand.
	You will collaborate closely with the Editor-in-Chief and Head of Social Content to ensure our visual output across editorial, video, and social platforms is strong, cohesive, and unmistakably Pulse. You will also lead and mentor a team of designers, setting a high standard for creative excellence and execution speed.


Key Responsibilities
Brand Identity & Creative Direction:


	Define and maintain the visual identity of Pulse Nigeria across editorial, social, and commercial outputs.
	Establish and evolve a consistent design system that aligns visuals across the website, social platforms, newsletters, and branded campaigns.
	Oversee the creative direction and visual consistency of Pulse Nigeria Originals and all editorial and social products under the Pulse Nigeria brand.
	Lead brand refreshes and visual improvements that strengthen audience recognition and trust.
	Approve major design assets, ensuring all visuals reflect Pulse Nigeria’s distinct voice and aesthetic.


Editorial and Social Design Oversight:


	Partner with the Editor-in-Chief to elevate visual storytelling across daily news, features, and special reports.
	Collaborate with the Head of Social Content to design high-performing templates, motion graphics, and visual frameworks that boost engagement.
	Supervise visual packaging for video content, ensuring consistency across Reels, YouTube, and TikTok.
	Develop guidelines for multimedia storytelling and ensure the visual layer enhances clarity and appeal.


Cross-Platform Consistency:


	Align design standards across the Pulse Nigeria website, social platforms, and branded content projects.
	Collaborate with Product and Tech teams to deliver a seamless, cohesive user experience across digital platforms.
	Provide creative direction for special projects, partnerships, and campaigns to maintain a unified visual language.


Leadership & Team Development:


	Lead, mentor, and grow Pulse Nigeria’s design team, fostering a culture of collaboration, speed, and quality.
	Implement efficient design workflows, review systems, and training plans for creative staff.
	Identify and fill skill gaps, ensuring the team stays current with tools and trends.
	Champion design thinking across departments and ensure creative quality at every level.


Innovation & Experimentation:


	Explore new design trends, motion formats, and creative tools that keep Pulse Nigeria visually relevant and ahead of the curve.
	Drive experimentation in visual storytelling and presentation, introducing new formats and layout ideas.
	Encourage innovation in how design supports editorial and social objectives.


Performance & Insights:


	Collaborate with Growth and Analytics teams to measure how design impacts reach, engagement, and viewer retention.
	Use performance insights to guide continuous creative improvement.
	Present regular updates to leadership on design impact and brand evolution.


Requirements


	7+ years of professional design experience, including at least 3 years in a leadership position.
	Proven record of shaping brand and visual identity for a media, content, or digital company.
	Strong portfolio showcasing editorial, social, and branded content design.
	Advanced proficiency in Figma, Photoshop, Illustrator, and motion design tools.
	Excellent leadership and project management skills with a focus on clarity and speed.
	Deep understanding of social-first design, typography, colour systems, and visual hierarchy.
	Strong collaboration and communication skills across creative and non-creative teams.


Benefits


	Flexible Hybrid Work Model
	Health Insurance Cover
	Group Life Insurance Cover
	Contributory Pension Scheme
	Annual Bonuses
	Telecommunication Allowance


Application Closing Date: 12th November, 2025. 

Click here to apply online

 

 

3.) Senior Digital Account Manager

Job Location: Maryland, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

The Role


	Pulse is lookingfor an experienced Senior Digital Account Manager.
	Our Senior Digital Account Managers are post-sale Digital Marketing Strategists responsible for the successful management of digital strategy for our client brands.
	You will answer key questions such as how brands are communicated and experienced through digital interactions, and how 360 digital interactions fit into broader customer experiences.
	You will help to achieve the client’s strategic brand and business objectives by providing them with guidance and working with the internal team to achieve seamless strategy delivery.


Duties and Responsibilities


	Develop effective post-sale strategies for clients in accordance with their requirements and ensure seamless execution.
	Proactively suggest innovative digital strategies to improve the quality of client campaigns.
	Ensure accountability is established during the project planning process.
	Produce content calendars according to dictated deadlines and to the highest standard.
	Full responsibility for ensuring work is delivered to the highest standard, on time and to budget.
	Achieve 100% realizations on all assigned accounts.
	Ensure proper internal QA is done before any work is shared with the client for review.
	Manage client relationships and provide clients with excellent service and support.
	Manage client expectations, bringing issues/concerns to clients' attention before they become problems, offering potential solutions, and advising of potential delivery delays.
	Provide campaign performance reporting and analysis to clients.
	Communicate effectively with all team members and develop strong, trusting relationships with all internal partners.
	Research and analysis of customers, market conditions and competitor data for relevant decisions and advice.
	Review new and trending technologies for regular knowledge updates to ensure our client offering remains innovative.


Requirements


	Minimum of 5 years of experience working as a Client Account Manager
	A professional qualification in digital marketing a plus
	At least Bachelor’s degree level of education preferred
	Great relationship-building skills to foster client relationships
	Great project management skills
	An innovator, trendsetter, and creative thinker who can connect 360° digital to all other aspects of a client’s business and drive growth opportunities
	A great content creator able to craft compelling digital marketing strategies that deliver results for clients
	Great copywriting, verbal and written communication skills
	Results-oriented and able to work both independently and within a team environment.





Benefits


	Flexible Hybrid Work Model
	Health Insurance Cover
	Group life Insurance cover
	Contributory Pension Scheme
	Annual Bonuses
	Telecommunication allowance


Application Closing Date: 4th November, 2025.

Click here to apply online
